title: Bilingual Review Press
text:
Bilingual Review Press is an American <a href="publishing%20house">publishing house</a> specialising in the <a href="publishing">publication</a> of scholarly and literary works by <a href="Hispanic%20and%20Latino%20Americans">Hispanic and Latino American</a> authors and researchers. It was founded in 1973 as the publisher of "<a href="The%20Bilingual%20Review">The Bilingual Review/La revista bilingüe</a>", a new academic and literary <a href="academic%20journal">journal</a> with a focus on Spanish-English <a href="bilingualism">bilingualism</a>, bilingual studies and Hispanic literature that was first issued in 1974. Under the <a href="imprint%20%28trade%20name%29">imprint</a> name Bilingual Press/Editorial Bilingüe the press also publishes and distributes <a href="book">book</a> titles by or about Hispanic and <a href="Latin%20America">Latin America</a>n authors, covering literary <a href="fiction">fiction</a>, poetry as well as <a href="non-fiction">non-fiction</a> titles relating to <a href="Chicano">Chicano</a> and <a href="Latin%20American%20studies">Latin American studies</a>. Bilingual Press publishes from 8 to 10 titles annually, with an accumulated back catalogue of more than 150 titles under the imprint in both English and Spanish as well as some bilingual editions. The publisher is also a distributor of related titles from other presses, numbering over a thousand releases.
Bilingual Review Press is based in <a href="Tempe%2C%20Arizona">Tempe, Arizona</a>, at <a href="Arizona%20State%20University">Arizona State University</a>. It operates as an autonomous sub-entity of the University's <a href="Hispanic%20Research%20Center">Hispanic Research Center</a>, which provides support services to the publishing enterprise. The press is maintained through a number of federal and private funding grants, including the <a href="National%20Endowment%20for%20the%20Arts">National Endowment for the Arts</a>, as well as returns on its publication sales.
The director and general editor since its foundation is <a href="Gary%20D.%20Keller">Gary D. Keller</a>.
The company was established in 1973 as a publishing entity for "The Bilingual Review/La revista bilingüe", a journal on Hispanic American studies and literature founded by Keller with support from scholarly grants. It was initially based out of the Department of Romance Languages at <a href="City%20College%20of%20New%20York">City College of New York</a>. In 1975 it moved operations to <a href="York%20College%2C%20City%20University%20of%20New%20York">York College</a> and then later to the <a href="State%20University%20of%20New%20York">State University of New York</a> at <a href="Binghamton%2C%20New%20York">Binghamton</a>. Since 1986, the Bilingual Review Press has been based on campus at Arizona State, following Keller's transfer to take up a position at the newly formed Hispanic Research Center.
Bilingual Review Press has published novels, poetry and essay contributions from both upcoming and established <a href="Spanish-language%20literature">Hispanic</a> and <a href="Latin%20American%20literature">Latin American authors</a>, including <a href="Virgil%20Su%C3%A1rez">Virgil Suárez</a>, <a href="Rafael%20C.%20Castillo">Rafael C. Castillo</a>, <a href="Alfred%20Arteaga">Alfred Arteaga</a>, <a href="Sandra%20Cisneros">Sandra Cisneros</a>, <a href="Daniel%20Olivas">Daniel Olivas</a>, and <a href="Rolando%20Hinojosa">Rolando Hinojosa</a>. Through both its own imprints and distribution of works first issued from other presses, it has also kept in circulation previous works of classic <a href="Latin%20American%20literature">Latin American literature</a>, reissuing lapsed or out-of-print titles by literary luminaries such as <a href="Carlos%20Fuentes">Carlos Fuentes</a>, <a href="Isabel%20Allende">Isabel Allende</a>, and <a href="Jorge%20Luis%20Borges">Jorge Luis Borges</a>.
Under the recently established imprint Clásicos Chicanos/Chicano Classics, the company publishes specific and notable works of <a href="Chicano">Chicano/Chicana</a> literature. It is also the sole distributive agency for <a href="Latin%20American%20Literary%20Review%20Press">Latin American Literary Review</a> Press publications, a publishing series established in 1980 devoted to English translations, <a href="literary%20criticism">literary criticism</a>, and bilingual <a href="creative%20writing">creative writing</a> on Latin American literature, such as <a href="Miguel%20%C3%81ngel%20Asturias">Miguel Ángel Asturias's</a> "<a href="Leyendas%20de%20Guatemala">Legends of Guatemala</a>" and <a href="Giannina%20Braschi">Giannina Braschi</a>'s <a href="Yo-Yo%20Boing%21">Yo-Yo Boing!</a>
